} } } Length:: 0:15 MinsThis of course is not my first HD TV. My first was a Toshiba DLP, and it was a lamp hog. Then a Toshiba 50 inch plasma, which failed in 3 years, then LG's first 1080p 60 inch plasma (Still working great), a Mitsubishi 73 inch DLP, (Still working great), and now, the ultimate plunge with this Sharp 80 inch TV.My viewing area for this TV is 12 feet at its closest and 15 at the farthest, and I instantly thought when I turned this monster on, that I should have stayed with the 70 incher. Oh well, it is mine and I am happy with it.For its size, this TV is well made and looks nice. Picture quality is excellent as close as 3 feet, and then as far back as you can go. I also purchased this TV from a major retailer in Texas because Amazon would not take 2 credit cards, and G. E. gave me more 36 months interest free credit at the Texas retailer than they did at Amazon on the store card, so Amazon lost the sale. I also looked for quite awhile at the, the Sharp 70 inch, and the Panasonic 65 inch VT30 Plasma, and I chose this TV for several reasons. Overall for size, quality, and looks, coupled with its truly great picture and excellent blacks. Remember, the better the blacks, the better the color, because black is the number one color in the color scheme.I gave this TV 5 Stars because of its numerous features and control ability with its menus. The picture is also superb, but the Panasonic 65VT30 still has a little better picture quality SAVE AND EXCEPT LED LOOKS MORE NATURAL. I ADD THIS BECAUSE I STILL HAVE MY 60 INCH lg PLASMA IN MY BEDROOM, AND THE SHARP LED IS MUCH EASIER ON THE EYES THAN THE PLASMA AND NOT OVER CONTRASTED. LED is rapidly gaining on plasma though. Overall, I love this TV, and I will finally stop looking for awhile, because it is like being in a movie theater every time I turn it on. It also does not have the delay when turned on like the Mitsubishi DLP. The other good thing is when this TV is on all day, it is cool to the touch, where the Panasonic plasma is not.Some settings from the calibration of my set, which I noticed was great out of the box, but it was somewhat to the red side on the tints. My calibration settings are as follows, and this was professionally done, and will help the rest of you get yours close. Mine now rocks!Picture SettingsMode - StandardBack light +8Contrast + 26Brightness + 8Color +5Tint + 8 to greenSharpness + 5AdvancedC.M.S. HueRed -1Yellow - 2Magenta + 2C.M.S. Saturation all at 0C.M.S. Value all at 0Color Temp all at 0Active contrast OnGamma - 1Range of OPCMax +4Min -2These settings should get yours into the calibrated ball park, and I have messed with the Sharp line of large TVs for quite awhile, and they are all somewhat to the red side out of the box. I also would not want to ruin a perfect record of Amazon Reviews by giving this TV any less than 5 stars, because I cannot. This TV deserves and has earned all 5 stars in this rating.UPDATEI started having picture problems with mine the next day, and almost sent it back, but I found a loose Monster HDMI cable, and it was also defective. A new Monoprice cable for 10 bucks fixed the problem, and the picture is absolutely stunning. So do not trust anything. Always check your cable CONNECTIONS, and don't pay those high prices for Monster Cables. They're not worth the price difference, and are way over priced.UpdateMine has been on 8 - 12 hours per day, and it has the most stunning picture over and above even the Panasonic and Lg Plasma. Trouble Free, and Sharp even called to make sure I was happy with the product. I have seen the 3d, and it is good, but I my self would not want to watch 3D all the time, so I am very satisfied with this product, and I would buy another one if I had a place to put it. Read the other reviews, this TV rocks and the picture far exceeds theater quality. I also recommend the DVDO Edge Green to which I own 2. One on my Sharp 80 and one on My LG 60 inch Plasma. The DVDO is a video processor with lots of features that will enhance any picture on any TV and up convert and signal in to 1080p 24Hz, and it really works, plus it automatically switches from the DVR to the next component turned on like a Oppo Blu-ray, or DVD Player or surround sound. The DVDO Edge is the best kept secret in the entire electronic industry, AND MINE IS ABOUT 3 YEARS OLD AND STILL GOING STRONG.February 5, 2013 UPDATEI am over a year now with this TV, and it has been the most enjoyable purchase I have ever made. I have not had one iota of trouble. The picture is clear, crisp and much better, easier to view, and not over enhanced like my 60 plasma. Honestly, I bought this TV because of its size, and now I realize, Sharp makes one of the finest products out there. It is all in the settings, and keeping the firmware up to date. Wish I had the money, I'd put one in every room, and now, I'd give it 10 stars.UPDATE: July 16th, 2013I have had many people contact me regarding this review, and I do not mind. I am glad I can help. My TV is still going strong, and trouble free. The other thing I want to say, is that my above settings were made after I had 100 hours on the TV and it had cooked in as we say. By then, all of the electronic components are fixed and all of the fluctuations are gone. I have not touched it since. Every time someone walks into my living room, their jaws drop. So I just want to say again, this is the absolute best money I have ever spent on entertainment in my 63 years on this planet. SO I CAN'T DO IT UP TOP, BUT I AM ADDING 5 MORE STARS TO THIS TV WITHOUT HESITATION!UPDATE: November 27th 2013Well, if you haven't bought one, you don't know what you are missing. I have not had one iota of a problem, not even a bad pixel, nor have I had to change any of the above settings. THIS HAS BEEN THE BEST ENTERTAINMENT $$$ I EVER SPENT. At first I was leary about Sharp, because they had their ups and downs. This TV has been a jewel and the crown of my entertainment system and it is a very top of the line TV. Glad I didn't get the quatron. To me, that TV has a yellow haze that is hard to remove during calibration. Save your money, and buy one, you wont regret it.Dale in Texas

Reviews.Title: More than just a big set
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I would consider myself a home theater enthusiast (although I am sure owning an 80" might be a give away on that ;) ).  As such, I constantly find myself comparing sound systems, displays, and other home entertainment devices with friends, or simply visiting stores or reading articles on the latest releases.  When I heard an 80" full backlit display would be available for under $4K I was intrigued, when i heard it was a Sharp I was skeptical...  Spending some time on AvsForum I couldn't help but notice all threads had nothing but glowing comments from people and calibrators I place a lot of trust in.I went to a local BestBuy to view it, and was disappointed.  However, having worked at CircuitCity in my college years I know all to well you cannot trust what you see in electronic stores as many simply have the contrast and backlight cranked up to the max, or using the dreaded "dynamic store mode".Luckily I had brought a USB key with some 1080P trailers and some settings from AvsForum to use as a reference. Settings in place, I immediately knew i had found my next set.Seeing the set in the store you realize it is very large, getting it into your house... well that is a feat in itself. Fortunately at just a bit over 120lbs it is not much heavier than the 60" plasma it replaced, but with nearly double the surface area it is a huge difference in a viewing experience.So onto the good items:Movie Theater Sized viewing at home (Yes, i know projectors are bigger, but for those of us without dedicated theater rooms this works great, even in bright room conditions).Picture quality (with the right settings this set is scary accurate and gorgeous to watch)Easy to mount (with a set this wide you may be concerned about finding a bracket to mount it, but the VESA mount points are industry standards and work well with a variety of mounts)Built in Wifi that works very well on my networkNice codec support on the USB playback. (I have watched many shows/videos/photos from a thumb drive)Understated design (this will vary from person to person, but I like my TVs to not draw attention to themselves when off, although with a set this big that is hard) It has a minimal, no frills frame that i prefer.Very good 60Hz performance while watching sports/fast moving shows. (I am not a fan of artificial refresh rates and keep mine in game mode)Playing PS3 on this set is phenomenal, as is Blu-Ray performance.Cons:Viewing angles at closer distance are limited (this is not a fault of the set, when viewed from an appropriate 10+ feet the viewing angle is quite good) compared to a plasma, but this is true for most non IPS LCD displays.Um... honestly i haven't found many other faults. Just don't expect for view from 5 feet away and have the same sharpness as a 40inch, this is made to be seen from a distance away.Overall, this is the greatest set i have owned.Couple of tips: if you want an extended service plan you can buy directly for just a few hundred dollars for a total of 4 years.  (This is the best deal I am aware of)Please (for your sake and mine) don't use dynamic picture mode!  Below are my settings (this is designed to be accurate to colors and brightness) but I encourage your to experiment to find your own settings as each set seems to have different Red saturation levels.Game Mode:opc offbacklight = 2Contrast  = 26BRIGHT = 1COLOR = -5Tint = 4Sharp = 0HueR 5Y 1G -8C 1B 3M -3SatR -10Y 2G 0C 0B 13M 1ValueR 3Y 0G 13C 0B 30M 0Temp (Low)R 13Y 0G -29C 3B 0M -18Active Contrast = OffGamma -2DNR = OffMonocrome OffRange of OPC N/AHappy Viewing!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: L.A.
Reviews.Content: We shopped for this locally because we wanted to see the size and picture quality in person and it's amazing. The picture is crystal clear and almost looks 3d due to the amazing depth it shows. We looked at it next to the 70" Aquos as well as other LED TV's and the Aquos line by far has the sharpest, clearest picture. If you are considering either the 70" or the 80" it obviously comes down to economics, but I can tell you the 80" definitely dwarfs the 70" when they are next to each other. We wanted a TV that would essentially look like a movie screen in our living room and the 80" takes up a big part of the wall. If you plan on wall mounting it, I would definitely suggest having a professional doing it based on the weight and the possible need for adding some additional framing to the wall you are mounting this on.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Matt N
Reviews.Content: Words can't describe how amazing the Sharp 80inch is. Crystal clear!!! BIG!!!! What more would you want??? It's a perfect home theater tv. I replaced my 73inch DLP with this 80inch and it is night and day better!!! If you want a big tv don't go cheap.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!!! WOW! WOW! WOW!
Reviews.Author: BabyBear's mom
Reviews.Content: This television is totally amazing!! Picture is crystal clear!! We have had this for less than a week and are already spoiled by the amazing picture!!! We had this set wall mounted professionally and it is just awesome! Hubby was considering a 73 inch tv, but when we saw this one next to a 73, the difference was too drastic to ignore. We could not be more thrilled. We do have a surround sound and this takes television viewing into a different realm. Personally, I would advise anyone in the market for a large screen television to check this set out. For the price difference, I am so thrilled we decided to go with this 80 inch set. We have a large den so this is perfect for us!!! We have no regrets, no second thoughts, no remorse at all over this purchase!!! We replaced a 58 inch plasma with this 80 inch set and the difference in size is astounding! I was concerned about the picture clarity since it is so big, it is 100% crystal clear!!!!! We had an amazing picture on the plasma, this is just as amazing! I cannot say enough about how thrilled we are!

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Home Theater TV
Reviews.Author: Jason Donovan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely outperformed my expectations in every aspect. The full array LED backlighting is incredibly vivid. The apps are excellent, the WiFi setup was a snap. The 120H refresh rate handles fast action flawlessly. I found the picture to be so crisp and vivid with BluRay movies, it looked like I was looking out a window at the action rather than viewing on a flat screen at times. The contrast ratio (blacks) and viewing angle are superb. The sound is even above average....I run my audio through a Yamaha YSP-5100 sound projector. Once, my children had switched the audio back to the TV speakers, I was unaware of this for a minute, thinking my subwoofer had been disconnected instead! The only thing I wasn't thrilled with was the audio input configuration....no RCA outputs - optical, 1/8" out, or HDMI out only.This TV also has an integrated media player, it will play photos, music, or video from a USB drive, or from network storage on a home network...even DivX. Easily the best TV I have ever owned (not just the biggest) and a worthy centerpiece of my home theater set. 5 stars easily, 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: My poor sofa...
Reviews.Author: Virtual Andrew
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic TV!  It's better than being at the movie theater.  It has lots of built-in features (e.g. wifi, online video streaming services) that I minimally use.  Its picture looks more life-like than other LCD/LED TVs, and I think it's better than plasma.  I had it shipped from the US Pacific coast (via Amazon), which had me nervous, but it went without problems and saved me a lot over the local big box that carries it.  I've had this TV for just over a month and so far I have no regrets...other than having just two of us wall-mount it (it's not heavy, but its size makes it awkward to lift); and, other than not having a sturdier sofa.

Reviews.Title: biggest tv i could find.
Reviews.Author: POINTFDR
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with my purchase I was up grading from a 55" projection tv one of the old Mitsubishi giant boxes from the late 90's and it was not HD well i have a large room and was looking for a large tv until sharp came out with the 80" for under $5000.00 i was biding my time i knew tv's were coming down so i waited.the Mitsubishi DLPS are large but the picture can not compare.the only problem was know i have to watch everything in HD it is really hard to watch such a giant screen with a poor picture.i got mine from pauls tv in Irvine.they matched the Amazon price on all my new gear.Denon Reviver,Blu-ray player and some new speakers.was going to wait for the next generation 80" with the 3D, Quattron, 240hz refresh and 100 Apps but i am not interested in the 3D or the More Apps but the Quattron and 240hz would be nice but not $2500.00 nice.And i would have to wait for April.

Reviews.Title: "If you want the WOW factor everytime you turn on ur TV, look no further than the Sharp LC-80LE"
Reviews.Author: B. Motta
Reviews.Content: The New Sharp LC-80LE is HUGE,  I didnt quite get it when Sharp compared it to 2 x 55" TV's, since its an 80" but now I can clearly see why, even my 2007 Phillips 63" looks small next to the LC-80LE - UltraBrilliant LED with excellent picture quality -  Full HD 1080p X-Gen Panel produces stunning picture quality with 8 million dots for the sharpest picture and with extremely accurate colors - Fantastic in bright rooms - Excellent video processing - Great for fast action Sports and Movies - Smart Tv with Apps like Netflix, Blockbuster Online, CinemaNow, Vudu and FB,  also has a cool remote designed for easy access to apps, its also energy-efficient, no wonder APPLE is partnering with SHARP, two of my favorite companies, so get ready for some amazing products coming down the pipeline ;DDDD

Reviews.Title: Just Buy It!
Reviews.Author: L. Brightful
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are a high-tech couple. We have all type of audiophile, videophile, computer hardware / software, eletronic equipment, etc. Tons of gizmos and gadgets. This TV rates as one of the top 10 (probably top 5) eletronic purchases we have ever made, period.Practically everything about this TV is excellent. The picture is STUNNING with Blue Ray, HD and high-resolution picture content. The black levels in particular are impressive. Even with lower definition content the picture looks good. The options / controls for the TV are exellent. You can tune the picture to your exact liking, and the standard picture settings are helpful and quite good. (We tend to like Dynamic - Fixed the best). The software on the device is solid. The built-in video / audio / picture software allows us to access movies, music and photos on our home NAS (disk drives on our home network) at the click of a button. VERY COOL, and limits the need of using our XBOX or PC just to stream certain types of media content to the TV. The TV also connects to the Internet for device updates and things like weather, news, Netflix and other common uses. Very cool, although the built-in apps on the TV are fairly basic and a tad slow ... not to be compared to PC apps and XBOX, but acceptable nonetheless.If you are concerned about it being too big, don't be. IMO, if you are at least 8-10 feet away from the screen you will not be overwhelmed. We have two chairs that are 6-8 feet away and our friends did not feel over-whelmed when watching a movie at all. In fact, the size is what we love. It makes viewing things like web pages SO much easier on our eyes.This is like having a projector / screen in your living room. The picture is incredible, the features are amazing and size really sucks you into the viewing experience. This unit is EXPENSIVE, but it really is worth the money if you can swing it. One of the best purchases we've ever made, and we have just about every popular gadget on the market. About the only knock is that the built-in software is a bit rudimentary and slow, so using the Sharp apps is somewhat under-whelming. For us, it didn't matter that much since we have a PC, Tivo and XBOX connected to the TV and can use them when needed. Other that that, this is a 5-star purchase for sure.(TIP: For PC users, check out the Silicon Dust Home Run device. It allows you to stream your cable TV signal to any PC, Mac or Linux machine in your house. For us, we use it to watch / record TV through Window Media Center. Last tip ... pair it with a $16 CE Compass remote control for Media Center, and I'm telling you ... you will be in for a treat.)Enjoy, and God bless.

Reviews.Title: Top Notch, all around
Reviews.Author: Suckerpunch Sweetface
Reviews.Content: Ordered through Amazon, Via Huppins retail, and delivered by Yellow Freight. First, the tv...Glorious. Huge, great picture, sold a 58inch Cnet award winning Panasonic 3D plasma AND a 55 inch cnet award winning LG full array local dimming Led Lcd in order to finance this purchase....worth it! Those two tv's were fantastic, but this is on a whole other level.Huppins was way helpful to make sure I was well prepared, informed and satisfied prior to sending the unit my way, and Yellow Freight went out of their way to make sure delivery was successful, driver even helped me carry it into my living room, despite only being obligated to "curbside drop off".Never had a bad experience w/ Amazon. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: Dale's calibration numbers are perfect
Reviews.Author: Charles T. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: The second review in this list was from Dale, and he listed all of the calibration levels that he had professionally done on his setup.  I received the 80 inch and it had a slight reddish tint in the coloration.  Not horrible, but not correct.  I recalibrated the TV using the numbers that Dale provided, and now the picture is perfect, thank you Dale.  If you buy this model, don't even think about it.  Recalibrate the TV using Dale's recommendations and you will be very happy.  Had a big party at the house, and left the TV on with the Olympics on.  Everyone would go downstairs to check out the new TV.  I had at least 15 to 20 people tell me how the quality of the picture was perfect.  I know that you could play with things on your own and come up with a great picture, but that would take a fair bit of time.  It is a no brainer, save yourself a lot of time consuming effort and just follow Dale's advice.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Bernie
Reviews.Content: Great Tv this thing is HUGE had it about a month now. works great picture is great, just make  sure u get a strap to hold the tv so it wont fall if u dont wall mount it.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: It is huge and has a fabulous picture.  The size of this TV when viewed from 12 foot is just perfect.  I was a little nervous of it being too big, but it is not.  I would have been disappointed with a smaller TV.  It does require some calibration and turning off some of the picture enhancers, but it can be tuned to deliver excellent color.  It probably won't be calibrated correctly at a store (Best Buy's was horrible), so it might not look great there.  The black levels are close to the absolute best I have ever seen.  The black levels in scenes can make it so there is no differentiation between the surrounding bezel and the screen.  For some reason the black bars on movies are a bit lighter than the black it will deliver in an actual scene (don't quite get why).  I have a high end Panasonic 58" plasma that has way worse black levels even in THX mode and CNET raved about its black levels.The price is high but worth it. Paid $3,797 plus tax at my local Best Buy with a price match done for another local dealer that had them on clearance.  Didn't trust getting something this big online (no offense Amazon as I love you).  I know it doesn't have 3D, but it didn't matter to me as I rather hate 3D.  Even theater 3D gives me a headache.  The standard speakers are a bit weak, but are kind of standard for TV speakers.  Another great thing is the matt screen doesn't have as much reflection of light as the shiny ones, yet doesn't diminish the picture at night.  I usually watch at night, but this TV is even great in a very sunny room that really washed my plasmas out.  I typically watch movies and scripted TV shows.  I can't vouch for sports or game use.If you can afford it and have a large space, buy it.

Reviews.Title: Goodbye Movie Theatre
Reviews.Author: Webduo "HD Fanatic"
Reviews.Content: Now granted I only just received the TV so I don't have any longterm experience, but I cannot say enough great things about it!  HUGE for one - but also watching a movie is a total different experience.  It's hard to explain but I swear there are movie scenes where it looks like you are watching it through a window, that is how crisp and clear it is!  I upgraded from a 73" Samsung DLP-LED (died after only 3 years) and I am now a Sharp customer for life.  Seeing is truly believing with this one...even if you have to save up for it.  The sound is typical of flat screens so I do recommend getting a decent surround sound system or at the minimum a small speaker like the Yamaha sound bar.  This isn't a TV, it's a WALL that shows movies :)Paired up with my Apple TV3 now I don't think I'm ever going to leave the house again.  COME ON FOOTBALL SEASON!!

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought it!
Reviews.Author: Kavid "Kavid"
Reviews.Content: Put in in a week ago and have nothing but good things to say about it.  I know it is 120 refresh but we have done everything on it including xbox, Wii, blu-ray, ROKU, and dish satellite tv and it has been a flawless picture.  The only ghosting we have had is on Madden12 during the kickoff there is some ghosting on the ball as it flies through the air (which is about 1 second worth).  The rest of the game is great as well as many other games.  It is big...so be prepared to sit a little further back (a couple feet is fine) verses a 55" or 60".  We can also recommend the ROKU.  It is awesome with so many free stations you can think about getting rid of cable.  The ROKU  also includes Amazon Instant movies that are free if you are a prime member.  We cancelled Netflix and paid for Prime and get all the free shipping savings on top of that!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Tim Ament "Tim Ament"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV via Amazon through Huppens and it was delivered the first week of April so I have had it about a month now.  I love it.  It is big, bold and bright.  The colors and black levels are great.  I would recommend this TV to my friends and relatives.  I like to watch sports and will say that in watching baseball sometimes there is a little streak when the ball flies across the screen.  I'm not sure what that is called but I did see other reviews that mentioned this too.  It isn't a big problem and I think I am the only one in my family that even notices it as I'm pretty picky when it comes to clarity of the picture etc.  My wife is wonderful and lets me have whatever toys I want and this one is a big toy.  We also bought a high end full surround sound system from a local retailer and had them install that.  The combination of the sound system and the TV makes a super home theater experience.  We have our furniture arragned in an L shape with the sofa at a 90 degree angle from the TV and two recliners facing the TV. The closest end of the sofa is only a few feet from the TV and off to the side and even from there, which is the least desireable spot, the TV is great.  From the other positions the picture is super.  The recliners sit about 9-11 feet from the television and that seems just perfect.Again, the experience with Huppens was great.  The box did have a hole in it when it arrived on the truck.  The driver (Yellow Frieght) was concerned about it and showed it to me.  It appeared to be in a cavity in the box and protected by the packaging.  He helped me unpack it on the driveway to make certain that there was no damage.  Then he even helped me bring it in the house even though I only paid for curb side delivery.  The bottom line is that the driver from Yellow, the packaging from Sharp and the customer service from Huppins all worked to perfection.  I had never ordered anything as major as this, in size or price, before on line and was pretty worried, but it all worked out great.  Don't fear, it will be okay if you order this through Amazon.  Don't worry.Really great buying experience and a really great product - FANTASTIC!Updated review 1 year after purchase -> I have now had this TV for about a year and still love it every day.  I am through baseball and football season and into the meat of basketball season and this baby is still perfection.  I could not be happier with a purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sharp 80" LCD
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: Tv picture quality and apps are great. Requires twopeople to lift due to size. Even close upthe picture looks awesome.

Reviews.Title: Monster TV
Reviews.Author: Ravan
Reviews.Content: I received this bad boy this morning. It was delivered by 2 very nice, professional gentlemen.The picture quality through my dvr is great, but it is wonderful when watching blurays like Skyfall, which made the picture look immaculate.I have another 60" Sharp and it has been great as well going on 3 years, even though it's an LCD.Your seating position should be about 10-12 feet away from the screen and you will be fine! The TV speakers are in the back and aren't so great, but most people have it hooked up to a sound bar/surround sound.Movie nights will never be the same again. I mostly wait for films to be released on dvd and don't really frequent cinemas that much anymore.I haven't connected it to the internet yet but that's next on the list. Will keep you posted! All in all, a very happy customer!I have the following settings for this set::-Picture Quality: StandardOPC: OffBacklight: +1Contrast: +24Brightness: 0Color: +2Tint: 0Sharpness + 2ADVANCED:-CMS Hue: -1 Red-2 Yellow+2 MagentaEverything else in CMS Hue at 0Everything in Saturation :0Everything in CMS Value: 0Everything in Color Temp: 0, except set it to Middle, instead of HighMotion Enhancement: OffActive Contrast: OnGamma Adjustment: -1Film Mode: OffDigital Noise Reduction: OffRange of OPC: Max: +4 and Min -2This ofcourse is my preference. You on the other hand might want to make adjustments according to your taste. Have a great day!P.S. I would like to thank Mr. Dale T. Morse as all my advanced settings are according to his specs. I just tweaked my set when it came to the actual picture settings. He is right on the mark, and has always been very helpful in all respects!I would also like to point out that this particular model was actually delivered to me 2 weeks back, but the delivery guys screwed the stand on incorrectly, therefore, the tv leaned forward from the left and was crooked on the side! I got a brand new replacement today from the retailer I do business with on a regular basis, and I am very, very pleased! Thanks!Warranty Info: This tv comes with a 1 year standard warranty which includes parts and labor. Now, if you register your tv on the official Sharp website, you will get an extra 3 months warranty. I bought a 3 year plan on their website for 180.00 plus they add on the extra 15 months, hence giving you 51 months of full warranty. The big retail stores are charging 800.00 for a 4 year plan, a rip off, I'm sorry to say! It's always best to do your homework in advance if you want to save some serious money.Update: March 5, 2013... I hooked it up to the internet and getting connected to Netflix was a snap. You can even hook up your laptop via an hdmi cable and enjoy online browsing or any video you wish to watch on youtube.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the Super Bowl
Reviews.Author: Jeff Wood
Reviews.Content: Finally pulled the trigger in time for the Super Bowl party.  Great picture and all my friends were appropriately impressed.  Replaced my 63" Samsung plasma which got promoted to the bedroom.  I have no regrets.  Delivered in side the house and unpacked by Forward Air.  They also took away the empty box.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING PICTURE, regardless of size!
Reviews.Author: DHT "d828"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 80 inch Sharp Aquos right before the Super Bowl (6 months ago) and everyone is amazed how sharp and life-like the LED picture is, especially for such a large TV.  Truely the best picture we have ever owned (and we also own a 42" Samsung and 42 inch Panasonic).  This is such a great TV that when we recently needed to buy another TV but a bit smaller for the space, we bought a 70" Aquos from Amazon and it is just as "insanely beautiful" to watch.  Football and action movies feel like you are THERE!  GREAT TVs.  And thin and light!  Would I buy again?  Just did (just slightly smaller size) - THAT says it all!!!

Reviews.Title: Not as sharp
Reviews.Author: Mal
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this TV and I have to say I am a bit disappointed! Yes the wow factor is there with how massive the picture is compared to my samsung's 63' & 64' but the problem begins when you turn the TV on. The picture is not as sharp as my Samsung's and the ghosting occurred a lot when watching football games this past weekend. Sometimes I have to make sure I'm watching HD channels because it looks like regular cable. I don't want to entirely rip this TV because well.....I am $4k invested in this bad boy. I used the gentleman's calibration setting and still falls short. Again I am comparing these to my two Samsung plasma's which too me are the best on the market. I'm just being honest in my opinion, I kinda wished I listened to my co worker and just went projection but the room has too many windows in key places. Hopefully In due time I can come back here and update this with a better review maybe with a different calibration or something. BTW, what's up with the apps?? Not youtube or internet browsing or pandora????

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: Mark Dunford
Reviews.Content: The TV is simply huge; but that is what I wanted!  I have loved the TV picture quality and the only negative is that there is an issue with the video image not syncing with the audio.  When I first got it, the problem was really bad but Sharp sent a new circuit board and now the problem is more minor.  Since I use the TV audio now through an external receiver (with a A/V sync feature) the sync issue is not noticed.  I only notice the sync issue when I play the TV without running the audio through the receiver.  I have the latest firmware.

Reviews.Title: No regrets. Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: WARREN PRICE
Reviews.Content: Out the box set up was easy. The TV even switches to DVD when you power up the player. The WIFI wireless was easy set up and its picture is awesome. Very happy so far.

Reviews.Title: This TV is huge!!
Reviews.Author: Mike Wiederkehr
Reviews.Content: I had seen this TV in a store, and it looked big then. But when it arrived at my house, and was finally mounted on the wall in the "man cave", it was bigger than I had imagined! I love it. I watched a blu-ray movie on it the first night, and it was spectacular. Picture quality was amazing, and with my surround sound system, it was like sitting in a movie theater. I've seen some reviews about bad picture quality, but that has not been the case with mine. At least, not so far. I have the Disney WOW calibration DVD, and will be using it to make sure all the settings are optimal. I've been told by friends and family that this will be the "football" house this year. Everyone that has seen it can't wait to watch the games on it. Only problem may be where is everyone going to sit. Our house will be "the place to be" this fall.

Reviews.Title: A superb TV
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Barron
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV, the picture is amazing, especially when viewing Blu-Ray discs.  We sit approx. 13 to 14' from the screen, and its awesome.  Delivered on time in great condition by PILOT.

Reviews.Title: Sharp AQUOS 80" Class 120Hz 1080p LED-LCD HDTV with WiFi
Reviews.Author: jlynn
Reviews.Content: If you can afford this and you have to wall space just do it. We also have a Sharp Aquos 60 inch that we swapped out with this big boy.  We put the 60 inch our Master Bedroom (makes it hard to get out of bed on the weekends :)My husband is a TV junkie but this TV has satisfied him for now.This TV just has a fabulous picture. We have a lot of light that comes into our Great Room during the day but it doesn't matter. Also, we have seating that is about 8 feet from it but that's OK too!Also, it is now a lot less in cost than what I bought it for last May, 2012. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: What a beast.
Reviews.Author: JeanPaul S Jordan
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for our conference room and it's a beast.  It's so damned big.  My 55 at home feels so tiny now.  When you sit in front of this thing, or even just see it on the wall, you just stop for a second and say "damn."  It's very nice.I look forward to getting one for home if I can sell my 55" and catch this new one on special.  It's stunning to look at.Those worried about 4K coming up.  Don't.  Content is scarce, even from the internet where the spread of metered connections is on the rise.  Most cable and satellite is still only 1080i.

Reviews.Title: Lots of defects with the screen
Reviews.Author: PR "anonymous-1976"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV from Amazon and it came with the screen cracked.  I returned it, and the second one had a defect where the picture was not clear. I returned that for a third, which lasted for 10 months until a vertical red line started appearing on the screen.  I am now in process with Sharp warranty to see if they will fix it.For the 10 months, the TV was great, no doubt about it.  It's just from my experience, I'm 0 for 3 with this TV, leading me to believe there is some defect in the manufacturing process, as Sharp is new to 80" LCD screens.

Reviews.Title: Very impressive for Powerpoint presentatons
Reviews.Author: JRB
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived in perfect condition. We use it  in our conference room for Powerpoint and video presentations. It works 100 times better than our old projection system. It is beautiful and clear. We have it connected to a dedicated desktop computer so presenters only need to plug in their flash drive and go. The only downside is that red laser pointers do not work and the green is barely visible. It is still very impressive!

Reviews.Title: Buy one right now! You won't regret it.
Reviews.Author: Powder Hound "Mediamine"
Reviews.Content: I love, love love this TV, it is big, but then you knew that - but really 80 inches finally got me to that theater feeling. I've had this TV for more than a year now and it has performed flawlessly. I should add that I do not use the built in speakers or tuner, just have it plugged in to my HT amp by HDMI. I advise turning off or way down all the motion / picture filters, or you'll feel like a camera operator on a bad soap opera, but with a small amount of tweaking the picture is quite stunning. It's a beast, I managed to haul it up the stair and install it by myself, but if you have a friend invite them over for and install and viewing party (I couldn't wait.) I have mine flush mounted on the wall and it is great.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Turned this one out!
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Duggan
Reviews.Content: It's large, bright colors, sound and surround sound is incredible.  It's smart TV capability is excellent, in addition to it's Wifi and web capabilities.  I can't ask for a better, bigger TV set.  You have to have a big room to put this one in.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: N Benson
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our media room and it is perfect.  The colors and picture are great.  We got it on Black Friday and got a great deal without fighting all the crowds.  Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: John White
Reviews.Content: I am so glad i went with this product.  It was between this and a 70inch and I will tell all of you guys out there, it does make a difference.  Great buy!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great picture - huge TV...
Reviews.Author: rrolff
Reviews.Content: This replaced the Sharp 60" we bought last year (which also has a great picture).  The size difference is enormous.  It has a similar picture to the Sharp 60 - crisp and bright.  You can search on the net for suggested settings - this helps the tone and balance...Sharp USA offers an additional 3 year warranty for $220 (good deal)...We love this TV...

Reviews.Title: Sharp 80' AQUOS
Reviews.Author: robert garcia
Reviews.Content: This is is a lot of television for three and a half thousand bucks, the picture is crisp and clear and the 120Hz is adequate for watching sports.

Reviews.Title: Big size, and good quality
Reviews.Author: S. P. Mann "Horse Whisperer"
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality TV. I see no problems with the pictures, like other reviewers say. Maybe they got a defective one? I am really happy with my purchase. The sheer size is almost enough to have your own theater. Its really cool!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for more !
Reviews.Author: Ronnie
Reviews.Content: Just got it last week ! This unit is so fine , I decided to build oak cabinetry around it from floor to ceiling . Top of the line ordering , delivery !!!

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: JOHN SPANGLER "Johnny Spang"
Reviews.Content: Without question, this is the best 80 inch Led out there now. I looked at the 90, but the picture was far inferior to this. I have DIRECT TV, PS3, XBOX 360 and my PC hooked up to it. 4 HDMI ports, all running HDMI. PS3 looks the best for HD movies. My direct TV is a bit disappointing for sports. I swear it's the signal though, because everything else I have hooked up to it looks magnificent. So I think if you have a lot of "noise" showing up on sports, it's not your TV, it's your provider.  It's not bad per say, but I think I might be wanting to call Direct TV to find out how to make that signal stronger.For movies and blu ray,  I thought something was messed up with movies, it looked like everything was recorded on a camcorder. It was mentioned on here before, but it was a soap opera look, if that makes any sense. The picture looked astounding ,but it was really bugging me. Where is my cinema feel? I thouht my eyes were shot. After doing some research, I found out its the "film mode" which is turned on by default. It supposed to make it look a bit cleaner. Which it does ,but it loses the cinema feel. Luckily you can turn that off. Althogh for documentaries and some movies, I do like to poke around with the "film mode" It does give the movie a totally different feel.If you're a gamer, you're going to be in heaven. I recommend going to the "game" picture. I think the refresh rate is higher because if I go to like Dynamic or standard, you're going to notice a slight delay. And for most games, you might want to just stick with "game"  there is no delay. For my PC, I keep it on Game too. I have a ton of games and again, with a delay, that's not good for gamers. So just make sure you got it on "game". The dynamic pic is probably better and prettier on the eyes, but Game is no slacker, so don't worry.The contorller is simple to use, the picture is great and I don't regret this purchase at all. The best 80 inch TV can be yours! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great Deal ... terrible delivery
Reviews.Author: oz
Reviews.Content: Sharp TV lived up to its billing ... great picture ... really big ... easy to set up. Could not be happier with TV, Amazon and Dealer. The delivery company is another story altogether. Two weeks past their quoted delivery date ... lots of excuses ... would never order anything that included the delivery company's service.  ONLY downside of buying thru Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture, quality and design! I  highly recommend it to anyone looking for an 80" TV.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: vera
Reviews.Content: We love our new TV. The quality of the picture is amazing and the size of this tv makes you feel like you are in a movie theater when watching a movie.

Reviews.Title: POWER BOARD OUT TWICE IN 6 MONTHS
Reviews.Author: JSCROUCH
Reviews.Content: GET THE WARRANTY... this is the second time we have to have the techs from sharp come out to fix this TV. Good thing for the warranty (we have to pay forever now). The only reason I'm giving this TV a 1 star is because there is not an option for a zero star. This TV would be amazing if I can watch it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV BUT
Reviews.Author: Emma M. Diaz "Emma R."
Reviews.Content: My husband decided that he just HAD to have this TV. I bought it for his birthday. The picture is fantastic and I really do love the TV. Fast forward to 29 days later and ALL the HDMI ports suddenly stopped working.... The next day so did the apps. 29 DAYS LATER!!!! Luckily SHARP gives you a year warranty..... They came a couple of days later and changed the main board which was the damaged part. I appreciate that BUT seriously? a TV that costs this much SHOULD not need servicing after less than a month .... I am seriously hoping I can extend the warranty with SHARP because I am afraid to think what will happen after the year is up......

Reviews.Title: Not that great
Reviews.Author: Jacklyn Rodman
Reviews.Content: Not that it was Amazons fault but to start out the shipping was very late. Four days past the promised date. There are a few things I do not like about this tv. First the resolution and definition is awful. It is just not as crisp as I expected.  I am not sure if all TV s of this type do this - but I hate that there is a delay between everything you do . Whether it is turning it on or changing the channel.

Reviews.Title: Too Sharp!
Reviews.Author: BW
Reviews.Content: This TV is so clear that I may get rid of my HD channels. I was good at playing BF3 before, now while playing i'm tend to pay attention to the background. I love that the TV has built in Wifi and has Netflix, so I dont have to wait for my xbox, wii, or ps3 to boot up.

Reviews.Title: Bad voice to lip movement.
Reviews.Author: PatB
Reviews.Content: I love my 80 inch TV but will send it back to the store if the "voice to lip movement" is not corrected!! The store sales representative and Comcast has tried to correct the out to sync problem. Every time they change menu settings the out of sync goes to other channels. There are approx. 12 channels I have a problem with. The Comcast HD box is connected to the TV by $100 12foot monster cables. The $1,500 Bose's speaker bar is connected to the TV by a optical fiber cable. I can correct the bad channels movement with analog wires from the Comcast HD box to a wireless head speaker set.  Therefore, to watch TV with voice and lip movement in sync I switch between the wireless speaker set and Bose's all night long. This is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: It's Worth Every Penny
Reviews.Author: R.P. McMurphy
Reviews.Content: I had to put my wife out to work the corner streets for six weeks straight to get this, but it was worth every penny and I am sure that she would agree though I didn't bother asking her.  Thankfully she got this in time so that it isn't too cold out and I can rub it in the faces of all of my family coming over so that I can rock out with MW3 all in the name of Christmas spirit.

Reviews.Title: Too heavy to set up more than once
Reviews.Author: Terrance Bryant
Reviews.Content: T.V. was defective. Because of the cold weather, you can't test until the unit warms up. By then the driver is long gone. Too heavy to set up and tear down and re-package to send it back. Wait for warmer weather and test while the driver is still there.

Reviews.Title: Horrible blurry picture, uneven backlighting, shoddy quality
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV at the end of last year after reading a lot of positive reviews on here about the quality of the picture. I currently had the bottom of the line Samsung 55" LED in the room, and was excited for such a great upgrade. Unfortunately the flagship Sharp has nowhere near the picture quality of the bottom of the line Samsung. Here are some problems:1. Colors are horrible. I have calibrated the screen according to settings posted on avsforum.com and it has greatly improved the color compared to how it came stock, but nowhere near as good as the old samsung.2. Backlighting is super uneven. Darker and lighter splotches are all over the tv. When I pull up just a plain white screen it looks like a marble pattern. So distracting and horrible.3. Motion is blurry and annoying.The television is huge, the picture quality is awful, the build quality feels super cheap and the whole product feels rushed and shoddy. I am going to return this TV and get something from Sony or Samsung. If all you care about is size, and nothing else, this is the TV for you, if you want a quality picture, then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV my A$$
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Morris
Reviews.Content: This TV hooks to the internet alright for only those apps it has loaded, it has no internet browser and the services are either overpriced or full of old media like netflix.  I would recommend buy a cheaper none smart TV and then buy the logictech smart TV box. I have three of them and they operate just likje a computer and you can add android apps to them.  Save your money and don't buy this product. Oh it also won't update the software through your wifi it has to be hooked to your LAN.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Isaac
Reviews.Content: I just got this thing in the other day and I can't believe the size of this thing. Picture was crystal clear, couldn't ask for anything better.haha jk im poor.

Reviews.Title: Runs Pong great
Reviews.Author: Anthony Garcia "that guy"
Reviews.Content: It also runs all of my Atari games perfectly. I haven't tested it with my NES yet, though Would recommend.:) :( :)
